questions.question: The change in energy along the IRP is:

answers.a: Energy increases on following the IRP from the TS to the minima
answers.b: Energy can increase or decrease depending upon the geometry of the transition state
answers.c: Energy decreases on following the IRP from the TS to the minima
answers.d: Energy remains constant throughout the IRP path

explanations.c: The transition state has the highest energy on the IRP path and the energy decreases on going towards the minima.

questions.question: The IRC s, can be expressed as:
On moving along the IRP, the energy along the remaining 3N-7 (non-linear molecules)/3N-6 (linear molecules) coordinates is:

answers.c: maximized for half of the coordinates

explanations.b: The energy along the remaining 3N-7/3N-6 directions are minimized along the IRP.

answers.a: Largest along the IRP and zero for the remaining 3N-6/3N-7 directions
answers.c: Zero along the IRP and non-zero along the remaining 3N-6/3N-7 directions

explanations.a: The gradient is largest along the IRP and zero along the remaining coordinates because at each point on the IRC, we minimize the potential energy along the remaining 3N-6/3N-7 directions.

answers.a: The gradient along the IRP is maximum
answers.b: The gradient along the IRP is negative
answers.c: The gradient along the IRP cannot be defined
answers.d: The gradient along the IRP becomes zero

explanations.d: The IRP is followed until the gradient along the IRP becomes zero i.e. one has reached a stationary point on the PES.
